meanings.definition: To cause (something) to fall into disrepair or ruin.
meanings.sent1: The neglect of the old house was dilapidating it quickly.
meanings.sent2: Leaving a car unused for years can lead to it dilapidating.
meanings.sent3: The lazy squirrel's hoarding habits were dilapidating its tree home.
meanings.sent4: The lack of maintenance was dilapidating the once vibrant community center.
meanings.sent5: The relentless storms were dilapidating the fragile sandcastle on the beach.

meanings.definition: To fall into disrepair or ruin.
meanings.sent1: Without proper care, the wooden fence started dilapidating over time.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned factory was slowly dilapidating as nature reclaimed it.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick went wrong, dilapidating his grand illusion into chaos.
meanings.sent4: The once bustling street was dilapidating into a ghost town.
meanings.sent5: The neglected garden was dilapidating into a tangled mess of weeds and thorns.
